title: How It Feels to Be Run Over

sources.title: How It Feels To Be Run Over (1900) Directed By Cecil M Hepworth
sources.description: How It Feels to Be Run Over (1900) director:Â Cecil M. Hepworth How It Feels to Be Run Over is a one-minute British silent trick film, made in 1900, and directed by Cecil M. Hepworth. As in other instances of the very earliest films, the film presents the audience with the images of a shocking experience, without further narrative exposition.

sources.title: How It Feels to Be Run Over

metadata.Plot: On a seemingly safe and dusty rural road frequented by horses and their carriages, a two-seated automobile is moving erratically. And then unexpectedly, in one glorious point-of-view shot, the vehicle dashes full-speed into an ill-starred passer-by, as the film ends with a rather enigmatic punchline: "Oh, mother will be pleased." Without a doubt, the man saw stars.
